verses.verse: (A Call to Repentance) (Isa 30.26; Jer 50.4, 5; Hos 5.14; 14.4) “Come, let us return to the LORD, for it is he who has torn, and he will heal us; he has struck down, and he will bind us up.
After two days he will revive us; on the third day he will raise us up, that we may live before him.

(Ps 19.6; Isa 2.3; Joel 2.23; Mic 4.2; 5.2) Let us know, let us press on to know the LORD; his appearing is as sure as the dawn; he will come to us like the showers, like the spring rains that water the earth.”
(Impenitence of Israel and Judah) (Hos 7.1; 11.8; 13.3) What shall I do with you, O Ephraim? What shall I do with you, O Judah? Your love is like a morning cloud, like the dew that goes away early.
(v 3|HOS 6:3; Jer 1.10, 18; Heb 4.12) Therefore I have hewn them by the prophets; I have killed them by the words of my mouth, and my (Gk Syr: Heb your) judgment goes forth as the light.
(Ps 50.8, 9; Hos 2.20; Mt 9.13) For I desire steadfast love and not sacrifice, the knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
But at (Cn: Heb like) Adam they transgressed the covenant; there they dealt faithlessly with me.
Gilead is a city of evildoers, tracked with blood.

(Jer 7.9, 10; Ezek 22.9; 23.27; Hos 7.1) As robbers lie in wait (Cn: Meaning of Heb uncertain) for someone, so the priests are banded together; (Syr: Heb are a company) they murder on the road to Shechem; they commit a monstrous crime.
(Jer 5.30, 31; Hos 5.3) In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing; Ephraim’s prostitution is there; Israel is defiled.
(Joel 3.13; Zeph 2.7) For you also, O Judah, a harvest is appointed. When I would restore the fortunes of my people,
